pageContext.description: Semi-lunar marking on hilt. 3 rivet holes: uppermost oval; rivets preserved.,3 rivets in wooden handle, traceable as wood-dust on discovery.,Position of pommel, probably of bone, measured before removal of dagger
pageContext.associations: Fond with skeleton in cist, 8' x 4' x 4': small flint and scraper carefully,placed with dagger; in the same barrow were 2 other rivetted (sic) daggers.
pageContext.publications: R.S. Newall, Wilts. Arych. Mag. - await. publication.
pageContext.collection: Private,,  R.S. Newall, Esq., R.S.A.,,  Fisherton Delamere House, Wylye, Wilts.,(1930)
pageContext.site: England,Wilts.,Amesbury,,on boundary of Idmiston.,Barrow, Round (Goddard's No. 85, W.A.M. XXXVIII, p. 170).
